numbered_ace_sentences: 1. For each major sports league, only 1 most recent year is given.
2. In the NFL, the disparity between the percentage of players of color and the percentage of leaders of color is 61 percent.
3. In the WNBA, the disparity between the percentage of players of color and the percentage of leaders of color is 58 percent.
4. In the NBA, the disparity between the percentage of players of color and the percentage of leaders of color is 50 percent.
5. The NFL has the largest disparity.
6. The WNBA has the second-largest disparity.
7. The NBA has the third-largest disparity.
8. MLB has one of the smallest disparities.
9. MLS has one of the smallest disparities.
10. MLB has fewer players of color.
11. MLS has fewer players of color.
12. I wonder how these percentages compare to the percentages from previous years.
13. I ask what initiatives are referenced.
14. I ask whether the leagues have shown progress.
15. I ask how the players in these leagues are affected by these disparities.
16. I ask whether the concerns of these players are addressed.
17. I am a high school teacher.
18. I think about how this data affects my students.
19. Some students are in the POC community.
20. The percentage of players of color could encourage these students.
21. The lack of representation in leadership could cause difficult thoughts for these students.
22. The lack of representation in leadership could cause difficult questions for these students.
23. I ask whether my students would be motivated to dig deeper when they see this data.
24. I ask whether my students would ask whether other people are concerned about this.
25. I ask whether my students would ask what is being done about this.
26. I hope that my students would find their voice to ask troubling questions.
27. I hope that my students would find their power to research further.
28. I hope that my students would find their power to advocate further.
29. Some progress may exist.
30. Some initiatives may exist.
31. These initiatives are implemented to address these disparities.
32. More work needs to be done.
33. The headline is: Commissioners mind the gap.
